episodes.title: The Car Salesman
episodes.plot: The Davids buy a house and move in but it makes settling sounds. Larry is not enthused about any show biz projects but does want and lands a car salesman job. Despite customers asking dumb questions, Larry does have a one ready to buy.

episodes.title: Thor
episodes.plot: Larry drives to meet Jason Alexander. A professional wrestler, Thor, yells at him for a finger gun shootout with his kids. Later, Larry's tires are slashed and he figures Thor. Recently separated, Jeff fears for sex secrets he told Susie.

episodes.title: Trick or Treat
episodes.plot: Larry offends two uncostumed trick-or-treaters by not giving them candy, so they show him the "trick" side of Halloween. He also alienates Cheryl's screenwriter friend Cliff and a Jewish neighbor AND spoils his romantic anniversary gift when Jeff arrives to play a round of golf.

episodes.title: The Shrimp Incident
episodes.plot: Larry gets takeout food and has a run-in with the same TV executive he is about to meet with to discuss his TV pilot idea. But after he gets home, he accuses the network exec of taking some shrimp from his dinner.

episodes.title: The Thong
episodes.plot: Larry no longer feels comfortable going to his psychiatrist after he sees him wearing a thong at the beach.

episodes.title: The Acupuncturist
episodes.plot: Larry promises to pay an acupuncturist $5,000 if he can cure his neck. Meanwhile, a struggling writer asks Larry for a $5,000 loan which he promises to pay back after his father dies.

episodes.title: The Doll
episodes.plot: Larry's attendance at a screening results in chaos; an unlockable bathroom door causes trouble.

episodes.title: Shaq
episodes.plot: After Larry accidentally trips and injures Shaq during a Lakers game, everything seems to start going his way.

episodes.title: The Baptism
episodes.plot: Cheryl and Larry head to Monterey to attend her sister Becky's wedding... to a Jewish man who's converting to Christianity. When Larry misplaces the plane tickets, he accuses other passengers of stealing them.

episodes.title: The Massage
episodes.plot: In the second-season finale, Larry is busted by a restaurant owner for stealing forks. Julia Louis-Dreyfus becomes so frustrated by the incident that she drops out of the pilot, which ends Larry's quest to get it on TV. Meanwhile, Cheryl learns that Larry got a naughty massage and busts him for that. He later faces an ironic punishment for his restaurant crimes.
